title: The extent to which circular economy principles have been applied in the design of medical devices for low-resource ... - Frontiers
summary: The article investigates the extent to which circular economy principles are applied in the design of medical devices for low-resource settings in Sub-Saharan Africa. The study found that medical device design in this context prioritizes durability, repair, maintenance, and upgrade to ensure longevity and accessibility. However, it highlights a lack of consideration for recovery and recycling aspects of a circular economy, leaving a gap in the design for sustainability.

title: PakTech and Braukon bring first automated handle applicator of its kind to Europe - Food and Drink Technology
summary: BrauKon, a brewery systems supplier and manufacturer, has partnered with PakTech to install automated handle applicator equipment for the first time in Europe. This collaboration allows BrauKon to offer a complete contract brewing service, including secondary packaging with PakTech's 100% recycled handles. BrauKon will also utilize the equipment for its own Camba cans, which are made from high-quality, opaque materials and feature individually designed labels.

title: UK Net Zero Research and Innovation Framework - GOV.UK
summary: This report outlines the UK's Net Zero Research and Innovation Framework, a roadmap for prioritizing public sector investment in research and innovation related to achieving net zero emissions by 2050. The framework identifies key challenges across various sectors, including power, industry, transport, and buildings, and outlines research and innovation needs to address these challenges. It emphasizes the importance of a whole systems approach, recognizing the interconnectedness of different sectors and the need for public support and viable markets to drive the adoption of new technologies.
greenwashing: The report does not describe any specific instances of greenwashing.

title: 10 New Technology Trends in 2023: Key Tech to Watch - EarthWeb
summary: The article discusses the top 10 technology trends in 2023, including AI, Genomics, Metaverse, Quantum Computing, Datafication, Blockchain, Green Technology, Robotic Process Automation, Hyperautomation, and Digitally Immune Systems. These trends are expected to significantly impact various industries, driving innovation and shaping the future of work and business. The article highlights the potential of these technologies to address key challenges, including climate change and cybersecurity, while also emphasizing the importance of continuous learning and adaptation for individuals and businesses to thrive in this rapidly changing technological landscape.
product_or_process: Green hydrogen and decentralized power grids
